title: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
description: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting downWindows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
OB: When shutting down the computer without saving the changes made to a dirty .txt file in a WSWB session, there is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their changes. The computer is shut down immediately.
EB: When shutting down the computer without saving the changes made to a dirty .txt file in a WSWB session, there should be a warning or question message box that allows users to save their changes before the computer is shut down.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it. Make sure the text file is marked as a dirty file.
3. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the “Shut Down…” command to shut down or reboot the computer.

Expected results:
- A warning or question message box should appear, giving users a chance to save their dirty model(s) before the computer is shut down or rebooted.

Note: This issue does not occur in other Windows programs such as Word or Outlook.
